plan_metadata.name: COMPETE MASTERS
plan_metadata.target_athlete: Masters cyclist (40+), competitive racer, recovery-first approach
plan_metadata.goal: Sustainable race fitness through polarized training with HRV-guided intensity distribution and extended recovery

workouts.name: W01 Mon - Rest
workouts.description:
• Welcome to Compete Masters. You're 40+ with 12-18 hours per week and want to race competitively. This plan uses HRV-Guided Polarized training—80% easy, 20% hard, with recovery driving the schedule. Masters athletes adapt differently: we need more recovery between hard sessions, but we can still build exceptional race fitness.

• WEEK PREVIEW: Tuesday has FTP + assessment testing. Wednesday is easy. Thursday has polarized intensity introduction. Saturday is long aerobic base. Sunday is easy + strength assessment.

• HRV GUIDANCE: If using HRV, check morning reading before intensity days. Green = proceed. Yellow = reduce intensity 10%. Red = swap for easy day. No HRV? Use perceived fatigue—if legs feel heavy and motivation is low, that's your body saying rest.

• REST DAY NOTE: Complete rest recommended for Masters. Light movement (walk, yoga) is fine.
workouts.blocks: <FreeRide Duration="60"/>

workouts.name: W01 Tue - FTP + Power Profile Assessment
workouts.description:
• STRUCTURE:
30 min warmup (progressive) → 5 min all-out → 10 min recovery → 20 min max effort → 15 min easy → 3 min all-out → 10 min easy → 1 min all-out → 15 min cooldown

• FTP (20-min avg × 0.95), plus power profile (5-min VO2, 3-min anaerobic, 1-min neuromuscular). Masters often have strong aerobic engines but declining top-end—this reveals your profile.

• MASTERS NOTE: Don't chase numbers from 10 years ago. Today's FTP is your training anchor. Progress is progress, regardless of absolute watts.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="1800" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.75"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="300" Power="1.20"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="600" Power="0.55"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="1200" Power="1.05"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="900" Power="0.55"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="180" Power="1.25"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="600" Power="0.55"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="60" Power="1.50"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="900" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.50"/>

workouts.name: W01 Wed - Easy Aerobic
workouts.description:
• Duration: 1.5-2 hours @ Z1-Z2 (60-72% FTP)

• True recovery pace. Nasal breathing only. This is polarized easy—genuinely easy, not 'kind of easy.'

• MASTERS NOTE: Easy means easy. If you can't hold a conversation, you're going too hard. Polarized only works if easy days are truly easy.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="600" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.62"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="5400" Power="0.66" Cadence="85"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.66" PowerHigh="0.55"/>

workouts.name: W01 Thu - Polarized Intensity Introduction
workouts.description:
• STRUCTURE:
25 min warmup → 4x4 min @ 108-112% FTP (4 min easy between) → 20 min cooldown

• Polarized = hard is HARD. VO2max efforts—should be gasping, not comfortable. 4-min efforts hit VO2max zone effectively. Recovery between = truly easy.

• HRV CHECK: If HRV is suppressed (yellow/red), reduce to 3x4 min or swap for easy day.

• CADENCE: High cadence (95-105 rpm) on hard efforts—reduces muscular strain, important for Masters recovery.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="1500" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.75"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="4" OnDuration="240" OnPower="1.10" Cadence="100" OffDuration="240" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="1200" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.50"/>

workouts.name: W01 Fri - Rest or Very Easy
workouts.description:
• Rest preferred. Optional: 45-60 min @ Z1 (55-65% FTP) if feeling good.

• MASTERS NOTE: Extra rest day before weekend volume. Don't underestimate recovery needs.

• REST DAY NOTE: Complete rest recommended for Masters. Light movement (walk, yoga) is fine.
workouts.blocks: <FreeRide Duration="60"/>

workouts.name: W01 Sat - Long Aerobic Base
workouts.description:
• Duration: 3-4 hours @ Z2 (65-75% FTP)

• Polarized long ride—all aerobic, no tempo or threshold. Building mitochondrial density and fat oxidation. Eat 50-60g carbs/hour even at easy pace—practicing fueling.

• MASTERS NOTE: Long aerobic rides build the engine without the recovery cost of intensity. This is your bread and butter.

• CADENCE: Self-selected, comfortable.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="600" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.65"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="12600" Power="0.70" Cadence="85"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.55"/>

workouts.name: W01 Sun - Easy Aerobic + Strength Assessment
workouts.description:
• Duration: 1.5-2 hours @ Z1-Z2 + strength assessment

• Easy spin. Assess current strength levels—bodyweight squats, lunges, planks. Note any mobility limitations.

• STRENGTH NOTE: Masters athletes MUST do strength work. Muscle mass declines ~1% per year after 40. Strength training is non-negotiable for performance and injury prevention.

• STRENGTH TRAINING NOTE: Perform your own strength training program. Suggested focus: Assess current levels—bodyweight movements, mobility, identify limitations.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="600" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.62"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="5400" Power="0.66" Cadence="85"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.66" PowerHigh="0.55"/>

workouts.name: W02 Mon - Rest
workouts.description:
• Week 2 establishes polarized rhythm: 2 hard days, rest easy. Quality over quantity on intensity days.

• WEEK PREVIEW: Tuesday has VO2max intervals. Wednesday-Thursday easy. Friday rest. Saturday long aerobic. Sunday easy + strength.

• HRV GUIDANCE: Establish your baseline this week. Note patterns—what affects your HRV? Sleep, alcohol, stress all show up.

• REST DAY NOTE: Complete rest recommended for Masters. Light movement (walk, yoga) is fine.
workouts.blocks: <FreeRide Duration="60"/>

workouts.name: W02 Tue - VO2max Intervals
workouts.description:
• STRUCTURE:
25 min warmup → 5x4 min @ 108-112% FTP (4 min easy between) → 20 min cooldown

• Polarized hard day. Five intervals—should be very hard by interval 4-5. If you can chat during these, you're not going hard enough.

• HRV CHECK: Green = full session. Yellow = 4 intervals. Red = easy day.

• CADENCE: High cadence (95-105 rpm).
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="1500" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.75"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="5" OnDuration="240" OnPower="1.10" Cadence="100" OffDuration="240" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="1200" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.50"/>

workouts.name: W02 Wed - Easy Aerobic
workouts.description:
• Duration: 1.5-2 hours @ Z1-Z2 (60-72% FTP)

• Recovery from intensity. Truly easy—nasal breathing.

• MASTERS NOTE: Two easy days between hard sessions is often optimal for Masters. Don't feel guilty about easy days—they're building fitness.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="600" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.62"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="5400" Power="0.66" Cadence="85"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.66" PowerHigh="0.55"/>

workouts.name: W02 Thu - Easy Aerobic
workouts.description:
• Duration: 1.5-2 hours @ Z1-Z2 (60-72% FTP)

• Second easy day. Building aerobic base without stress.

• POLARIZED PRINCIPLE: 80% of training time at Z1-Z2. This feels like too much easy riding—that's the point. Adaptation happens during recovery.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="600" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.62"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="5400" Power="0.66" Cadence="85"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.66" PowerHigh="0.55"/>

workouts.name: W02 Fri - Rest
workouts.description:
• Complete rest before weekend.

• MASTERS NOTE: Friday rest sets up quality weekend training. Resist temptation to add junk miles.

• REST DAY NOTE: Complete rest recommended for Masters. Light movement (walk, yoga) is fine.
workouts.blocks: <FreeRide Duration="60"/>

workouts.name: W02 Sat - Long Aerobic Base
workouts.description:
• Duration: 3.5-4.5 hours @ Z2 (65-75% FTP)

• Building aerobic volume. All easy—no tempo, no surges. Practice race nutrition (60-70g carbs/hour).

• MASTERS NOTE: Long slow distance builds durability without the recovery cost. This is smart training, not lazy training.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="600" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.65"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="14400" Power="0.70" Cadence="85"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.55"/>

workouts.name: W02 Sun - Easy Aerobic + Max Strength
workouts.description:
• Duration: 1.5-2 hours @ Z1-Z2 + 45-50 min strength

• Easy ride. Begin max strength phase—heavy loads, low reps.

• STRENGTH TRAINING NOTE: Perform your own strength training program. Suggested focus: Back squats, Romanian deadlifts, step-ups (4x6 @ 80% 1RM). Max strength phase. Rest 3-4 min between sets.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="600" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.62"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="5400" Power="0.66" Cadence="85"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.66" PowerHigh="0.55"/>

workouts.name: W03 Mon - Rest
workouts.description:
• Week 3 progresses intensity slightly while maintaining polarized structure.

• WEEK PREVIEW: Tuesday has extended VO2max. Thursday has threshold touch (brief, controlled). Saturday is peak long aerobic. Sunday easy + strength.

• HRV GUIDANCE: Watch for cumulative fatigue. If HRV trends down over several days, consider extra rest.

• REST DAY NOTE: Complete rest recommended for Masters. Light movement (walk, yoga) is fine.
workouts.blocks: <FreeRide Duration="60"/>

workouts.name: W03 Tue - Extended VO2max
workouts.description:
• STRUCTURE:
25 min warmup → 5x5 min @ 106-110% FTP (4 min easy between) → 20 min cooldown

• Longer intervals—5 minutes pushes deeper into VO2max. Should be very difficult.

• HRV CHECK: Green = full session. Yellow = 4x5 min. Red = easy day.

• CADENCE: High cadence (95-105 rpm).
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="1500" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.75"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="5" OnDuration="300" OnPower="1.08" Cadence="100" OffDuration="240" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="1200" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.50"/>

workouts.name: W03 Wed - Easy Aerobic
workouts.description:
• Duration: 1.5-2 hours @ Z1-Z2

• Recovery. Easy.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="600" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.62"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="5400" Power="0.66" Cadence="85"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.66" PowerHigh="0.55"/>

workouts.name: W03 Thu - Threshold Touch
workouts.description:
• STRUCTURE:
25 min warmup → 2x12 min @ 95-100% FTP (6 min easy between) → 20 min cooldown

• Brief threshold work. In polarized training, threshold is used sparingly—it's the 'gray zone' that can accumulate fatigue without clear benefit. This session introduces race-pace feel.

• MASTERS NOTE: Threshold work is recovery-expensive. Use it strategically, not constantly.

• CADENCE: Self-selected race cadence.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="1500" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.75"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="2" OnDuration="720" OnPower="0.98" Cadence="90" OffDuration="360" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="1200" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.50"/>

workouts.name: W03 Fri - Rest
workouts.description:
• Complete rest.

• REST DAY NOTE: Complete rest recommended for Masters. Light movement (walk, yoga) is fine.
workouts.blocks: <FreeRide Duration="60"/>

workouts.name: W03 Sat - Peak Long Aerobic
workouts.description:
• Duration: 4-5 hours @ Z2 (65-75% FTP)

• Peak aerobic volume for Base phase. All easy—build durability. Practice all race systems—nutrition (70-80g carbs/hour), hydration, gear.

• MASTERS NOTE: This is foundation building. Strong aerobic base = sustainable race efforts later.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="600" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.65"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="16200" Power="0.70" Cadence="85"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.55"/>

workouts.name: W03 Sun - Easy Aerobic + Max Strength
workouts.description:
• Duration: 1.5-2 hours @ Z1-Z2 + 45-50 min strength

• Easy ride. Continue max strength.

• STRENGTH TRAINING NOTE: Perform your own strength training program. Suggested focus: Progress loads slightly—squats, deadlifts, lunges (4x5-6 @ 82-85% 1RM). Max strength continues.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="600" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.62"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="5400" Power="0.66" Cadence="85"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.66" PowerHigh="0.55"/>

workouts.name: W04 Mon - Rest
workouts.description:
• Recovery week. Adaptation happens during rest. By Sunday you should feel fresh and powerful.

• WEEK PREVIEW: Light intensity Tuesday. Easy Wednesday-Friday. Moderate Saturday. Easy Sunday.

• HRV GUIDANCE: HRV should trend upward this week. If not, address sleep, nutrition, life stress.

• MASTERS NOTE: Masters athletes often need MORE recovery than prescribed. Add an extra rest day if still tired by Wednesday.

• REST DAY NOTE: Complete rest recommended for Masters. Light movement (walk, yoga) is fine.
workouts.blocks: <FreeRide Duration="60"/>

workouts.name: W04 Tue - Light VO2 Touch
workouts.description:
• STRUCTURE:
25 min warmup → 3x3 min @ 105-108% FTP (4 min easy between) → 20 min cooldown

• Maintenance intensity. Should feel controlled, not crushing.

• HRV CHECK: Skip if HRV is yellow/red.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="1500" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.75"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="3" OnDuration="180" OnPower="1.06" Cadence="100" OffDuration="240" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="1200" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.50"/>

workouts.name: W04 Wed - Easy Aerobic
workouts.description:
• Duration: 1-1.5 hours @ Z1-Z2

• Very easy. Recovery focus.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="600" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.60"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="3600" Power="0.65" Cadence="85"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.65" PowerHigh="0.55"/>

workouts.name: W04 Thu - Easy Aerobic
workouts.description:
• Duration: 1-1.5 hours @ Z1-Z2

• Easy recovery.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="600" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.60"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="3600" Power="0.65" Cadence="85"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.65" PowerHigh="0.55"/>

workouts.name: W04 Fri - Rest
workouts.description:
• Complete rest.

• REST DAY NOTE: Complete rest recommended for Masters. Light movement (walk, yoga) is fine.
workouts.blocks: <FreeRide Duration="60"/>

workouts.name: W04 Sat - Moderate Aerobic
workouts.description:
• Duration: 2.5-3 hours @ Z2

• Moderate volume. Should feel refreshing, not tiring.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="600" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.65"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="9000" Power="0.68" Cadence="85"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.68" PowerHigh="0.55"/>

workouts.name: W04 Sun - Easy Aerobic + Transition Strength
workouts.description:
• Duration: 1-1.5 hours @ Z1-Z2 + 40 min strength

• Easy. Strength transitions to power phase.

• STRENGTH TRAINING NOTE: Perform your own strength training program. Suggested focus: Reduce load, add speed—jump squats, med ball throws (3x8 explosive). Power transition.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="600" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.60"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="3600" Power="0.65" Cadence="85"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.65" PowerHigh="0.55"/>

workouts.name: W05 Mon - Rest
workouts.description:
• Build phase begins. Adding race-specific intensity while maintaining polarized structure. Two hard days per week, quality paramount.

• WEEK PREVIEW: Tuesday has VO2max + threshold combo. Thursday has race-pace work. Saturday is long ride with race simulation. Sunday easy + power strength.

• HRV GUIDANCE: Build phases are stressful. Monitor HRV closely—back off at first sign of accumulated fatigue.

• REST DAY NOTE: Complete rest recommended for Masters. Light movement (walk, yoga) is fine.
workouts.blocks: <FreeRide Duration="60"/>

workouts.name: W05 Tue - VO2max + Threshold Combo
workouts.description:
• STRUCTURE:
25 min warmup → 4x4 min @ 108-112% FTP (4 min easy) → 10 min easy → 2x10 min @ 95-100% FTP (5 min easy) → 15 min cooldown

• VO2 first (hard), then threshold (race pace). Simulates racing—high-intensity surges followed by sustained effort.

• HRV CHECK: Green = full session. Yellow = reduce threshold to 2x8 min. Red = easy day.

• CADENCE: VO2 high cadence (100+ rpm), threshold self-selected.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="1500" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.75"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="4" OnDuration="240" OnPower="1.10" Cadence="100" OffDuration="240" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="600" Power="0.55"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="2" OnDuration="600" OnPower="0.98" Cadence="90" OffDuration="300" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="900" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.50"/>

workouts.name: W05 Wed - Easy Aerobic
workouts.description:
• Duration: 1.5-2 hours @ Z1-Z2

• Recovery. Easy.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="600" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.62"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="5400" Power="0.66" Cadence="85"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.66" PowerHigh="0.55"/>

workouts.name: W05 Thu - Race-Pace Intervals
workouts.description:
• STRUCTURE:
25 min warmup → 3x12 min @ 93-98% FTP (6 min easy between) → 15 min cooldown

• Race pace—sustainable threshold. This is your target power for race day. Practice race breathing, race focus.

• CADENCE: Race cadence (self-selected).
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="1500" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.75"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="3" OnDuration="720" OnPower="0.95" Cadence="90" OffDuration="360" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="900" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.50"/>

workouts.name: W05 Fri - Rest
workouts.description:
• Complete rest.

• REST DAY NOTE: Complete rest recommended for Masters. Light movement (walk, yoga) is fine.
workouts.blocks: <FreeRide Duration="60"/>

workouts.name: W05 Sat - Long Ride + Race Simulation
workouts.description:
• STRUCTURE:
First 2 hours Z2 → 3x15 min @ 93-98% FTP (6 min easy between) → Final 1.5 hours Z2

• Race simulation within long ride. Sustained race pace when fatigued. Practice nutrition (70-80g carbs/hour).

• MASTERS NOTE: This is the key session of the week. If you can only do one quality ride, do this one.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="600" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.65"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="7200" Power="0.70" Cadence="85"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="3" OnDuration="900" OnPower="0.95" Cadence="90" OffDuration="360" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="5400" Power="0.70" Cadence="85"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.55"/>

workouts.name: W05 Sun - Easy Aerobic + Power Strength
workouts.description:
• Duration: 1.5-2 hours @ Z1-Z2 + 40-45 min strength

• Easy ride. Power phase strength.

• STRENGTH TRAINING NOTE: Perform your own strength training program. Suggested focus: Explosive movements—box jumps, jump squats, power cleans (4x5 explosive). Power phase.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="600" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.62"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="5400" Power="0.66" Cadence="85"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.66" PowerHigh="0.55"/>

workouts.name: W06 Mon - Rest
workouts.description:
• Peak build week. Highest quality of the plan. Make every hard session count.

• WEEK PREVIEW: Tuesday has peak VO2 + threshold. Thursday has extended race-pace. Saturday is peak long race simulation. Sunday easy + strength.

• HRV GUIDANCE: Critical week for monitoring. Don't push through suppressed HRV—better to reduce one session than blow up the whole week.

• REST DAY NOTE: Complete rest recommended for Masters. Light movement (walk, yoga) is fine.
workouts.blocks: <FreeRide Duration="60"/>

workouts.name: W06 Tue - Peak VO2 + Threshold
workouts.description:
• STRUCTURE:
25 min warmup → 5x4 min @ 108-112% FTP (4 min easy) → 10 min easy → 2x12 min @ 95-100% FTP (6 min easy) → 15 min cooldown

• Peak quality session. VO2 intervals + extended threshold. Should be very hard.

• HRV CHECK: Green = full session. Yellow = reduce VO2 to 4 intervals. Red = reschedule.

• CADENCE: VO2 high cadence (100+ rpm), threshold mix.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="1500" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.75"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="5" OnDuration="240" OnPower="1.10" Cadence="100" OffDuration="240" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="600" Power="0.55"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="2" OnDuration="720" OnPower="0.98" Cadence="90" OffDuration="360" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="900" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.50"/>

workouts.name: W06 Wed - Easy Aerobic
workouts.description:
• Duration: 1.5-2 hours @ Z1-Z2

• Critical recovery day. Stay easy.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="600" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.62"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="5400" Power="0.66" Cadence="85"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.66" PowerHigh="0.55"/>

workouts.name: W06 Thu - Extended Race-Pace
workouts.description:
• STRUCTURE:
25 min warmup → 2x15 min @ 95-100% FTP (8 min easy between) → 4x2 min @ 105-110% FTP (3 min easy) → 15 min cooldown

• Extended threshold + brief over-threshold surges. Race simulation intensity.

• CADENCE: Threshold self-selected, surges high cadence (100+ rpm).
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="1500" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.75"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="2" OnDuration="900" OnPower="0.98" Cadence="90" OffDuration="480" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="4" OnDuration="120" OnPower="1.08" Cadence="100" OffDuration="180" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="900" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.50"/>

workouts.name: W06 Fri - Rest
workouts.description:
• Complete rest before peak long ride.

• REST DAY NOTE: Complete rest recommended for Masters. Light movement (walk, yoga) is fine.
workouts.blocks: <FreeRide Duration="60"/>

workouts.name: W06 Sat - Peak Long Race Simulation
workouts.description:
• STRUCTURE:
First 2 hours Z2 → 4x15 min @ 93-98% FTP (6 min easy between) → 3x3 min @ 105-110% FTP (4 min easy) → Final 1.5 hours Z2

• Peak race simulation. Sustained race pace + surges within long ride. Test everything—nutrition (80g carbs/hour), hydration, gear, mental focus.

• MASTERS NOTE: This is your fitness peak. Execute well and trust the work.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="600" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.65"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="7200" Power="0.70" Cadence="85"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="4" OnDuration="900" OnPower="0.95" Cadence="90" OffDuration="360" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="3" OnDuration="180" OnPower="1.08" Cadence="100" OffDuration="240" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="5400" Power="0.70" Cadence="85"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.55"/>

workouts.name: W06 Sun - Easy Aerobic + Maintenance Strength
workouts.description:
• Duration: 1.5-2 hours @ Z1-Z2 + 35-40 min strength

• Easy ride. Strength transitions to maintenance.

• STRENGTH TRAINING NOTE: Perform your own strength training program. Suggested focus: Maintenance—moderate loads, movement quality (3x8). Maintaining strength gains through race prep.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="600" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.62"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="5400" Power="0.66" Cadence="85"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.66" PowerHigh="0.55"/>

workouts.name: W07 Mon - Rest
workouts.description:
• Recovery week. Absorb the build phase work. You should feel fresh and powerful by Sunday.

• WEEK PREVIEW: Light intensity Tuesday. Easy Wednesday-Friday. Moderate Saturday. Easy Sunday.

• HRV GUIDANCE: HRV should recover strongly this week. If still suppressed by Thursday, extend recovery.

• REST DAY NOTE: Complete rest recommended for Masters. Light movement (walk, yoga) is fine.
workouts.blocks: <FreeRide Duration="60"/>

workouts.name: W07 Tue - Light Intensity Touch
workouts.description:
• STRUCTURE:
25 min warmup → 3x4 min @ 105-108% FTP (4 min easy between) → 15 min cooldown

• Maintenance. Should feel controlled.

• HRV CHECK: Skip if HRV still suppressed.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="1500" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.75"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="3" OnDuration="240" OnPower="1.06" Cadence="100" OffDuration="240" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="900" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.50"/>

workouts.name: W07 Wed - Easy Aerobic
workouts.description:
• Duration: 1-1.5 hours @ Z1-Z2

• Very easy recovery.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="600" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.60"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="3600" Power="0.65" Cadence="85"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.65" PowerHigh="0.55"/>

workouts.name: W07 Thu - Easy Aerobic
workouts.description:
• Duration: 1-1.5 hours @ Z1-Z2

• Easy recovery.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="600" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.60"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="3600" Power="0.65" Cadence="85"/>

workouts.name: W08 Mon - Rest
workouts.description:
• Race sharpening begins. Quality over quantity. Every session should leave you feeling sharp, not tired. Four weeks to race.

• WEEK PREVIEW: Tuesday has sharpening intervals. Thursday has race openers. Saturday is race simulation. Sunday easy.

• HRV GUIDANCE: You should be consistently in green zone. Any suppression = back off immediately.

• REST DAY NOTE: Complete rest recommended for Masters. Light movement (walk, yoga) is fine.
workouts.blocks: <FreeRide Duration="60"/>

workouts.name: W08 Tue - Sharpening Intervals
workouts.description:
• STRUCTURE:
25 min warmup → 4x5 min @ 105-110% FTP (5 min easy between) → 2x8 min @ 95-100% FTP (5 min easy) → 15 min cooldown

• Over-threshold to sharpen top-end + threshold for race pace. Should feel powerful, controlled.

• CADENCE: High cadence (100+ rpm) throughout.

<Warmup Duration="1500" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.75"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="4" OnDuration="300" OnPower="1.08" Cadence="100" OffDuration="300" OffPower="0.55"/>

• REST DAY NOTE: Complete rest recommended for Masters. Light movement (walk, yoga) is fine.

• MASTERS NOTE: Visualize race day. Practice start, key moments, finish.

• WEEK PREVIEW: Tuesday has taper quality. Thursday has easy + openers. Saturday is final tune-up. Sunday easy or rest.

• HRV GUIDANCE: Should be strong green. You're tapering—feel the freshness building.

• MASTERS NOTE: Trust the taper. Resist adding extra riding. Your body is absorbing the work.

• REST DAY NOTE: Complete rest recommended for Masters. Light movement (walk, yoga) is fine.

• REST DAY NOTE: Complete rest recommended for Masters. Light movement (walk, yoga) is fine.

30 min easy → 2x8 min @ 90-95% FTP (4 min easy between) → 3x2 min @ 105% FTP (3 min easy) → 25 min easy

• MASTERS NOTE: You're ready. Trust the work.

workouts.name: W12 Mon - Rest
workouts.description:
• RACE WEEK. Minimal riding. Maximum freshness. You should feel powerful, eager, ready. Trust the work.

• WEEK PREVIEW: Tuesday has activation. Wednesday rest or very easy. Thursday has openers. Friday is pre-race. Saturday/Sunday is race.

• HRV GUIDANCE: Peak readings. Nervous energy is normal—channel it.

• REST DAY NOTE: Complete rest recommended for Masters. Light movement (walk, yoga) is fine.
workouts.blocks: <FreeRide Duration="60"/>

workouts.name: W12 Tue - Activation
workouts.description:
• STRUCTURE:
25 min easy → 3x4 min @ 90-95% FTP (4 min easy between) → 4x1 min @ 110% FTP (2 min easy) → 15 min easy

• Wake up systems. Confirm everything works. Should feel snappy, eager.

• CADENCE: High cadence (100+ rpm) on efforts.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="600" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.65"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="1500" Power="0.65" Cadence="85"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="3" OnDuration="240" OnPower="0.93" Cadence="90" OffDuration="240" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="4" OnDuration="60" OnPower="1.10" Cadence="100" OffDuration="120" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="900" PowerLow="0.65" PowerHigh="0.55"/>

workouts.name: W12 Wed - Rest or Very Easy
workouts.description:
• Rest preferred. Optional: 30-45 min @ Z1 if you need to move.

• MASTERS NOTE: Extra rest is always right choice race week.

• REST DAY NOTE: Complete rest recommended for Masters. Light movement (walk, yoga) is fine.
workouts.blocks: <FreeRide Duration="60"/>

workouts.name: W12 Thu - Openers
workouts.description:
• STRUCTURE:
25 min easy → 3x3 min @ 95-100% FTP (3 min easy between) → 4x30 sec @ 115% FTP (90 sec easy) → 15 min easy

• Short openers. Keep systems firing. Should feel fresh, powerful.

• CADENCE: High cadence (100+ rpm).
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="600" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.65"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="1500" Power="0.65" Cadence="85"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="3" OnDuration="180" OnPower="0.98" Cadence="95" OffDuration="180" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="4" OnDuration="30" OnPower="1.15" Cadence="100" OffDuration="90" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="900" PowerLow="0.65" PowerHigh="0.55"/>

workouts.name: W12 Fri - Pre-Race
workouts.description:
• STRUCTURE:
20 min easy → 3x3 min @ race pace (3 min easy between) → 4x30 sec @ 110% FTP (90 sec easy) → 15 min easy

• Final ride. Prime the engine. Check bike. Visualize tomorrow.

• CADENCE: High cadence (100+ rpm).
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="600" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.65"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="1200" Power="0.65" Cadence="85"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="3" OnDuration="180" OnPower="0.95" Cadence="90" OffDuration="180" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="4" OnDuration="30" OnPower="1.10" Cadence="100" OffDuration="90" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="900" PowerLow="0.65" PowerHigh="0.55"/>

workouts.name: W12 Sat - Race Day or Rest
workouts.description:
• If racing Saturday: RACE DAY—EXECUTE YOUR PLAN

• If racing Sunday: Complete rest or 30-45 min with brief openers

• Race Day Notes: Start controlled, find your group, fuel aggressively (70-80g carbs/hour). Polarized training built your aerobic engine—use it. Race conservatively first half, push second half. Your HRV-guided approach means you're fresh and ready. Trust the work.

• MASTERS NOTE: Experience is your advantage. Race smart, stay hydrated, don't chase early attacks. You've trained for this.
workouts.blocks: <FreeRide Duration="60"/>

workouts.name: W12 Sun - Race Day or Recovery
workouts.description:
• If racing Sunday: RACE DAY—EXECUTE YOUR PLAN

• If raced Saturday: 30-45 min easy spin, celebrate

• Race Day Notes: 12 weeks of HRV-guided polarized training has built sustainable race fitness. Your aerobic base is strong, your top-end is sharp, and your body is fresh. Start smart, fuel consistently, and finish strong.

• MASTERS NOTE: Age brings wisdom. Race the event, not the ego. You've prepared intelligently—now execute intelligently. Dominate your category.
workouts.blocks: <FreeRide Duration="60"/>

hrv_guided_polarized_philosophy.description: HRV-Guided Polarized training for Masters athletes—80% easy, 20% hard, recovery driving schedule
hrv_guided_polarized_philosophy.intensity_distribution: Two hard days per week, quality paramount, extended recovery between intensity sessions
hrv_guided_polarized_philosophy.principle: Masters athletes adapt differently—more recovery needed, but exceptional race fitness still achievable

hrv_guidance.yellow: Reduce intensity by 10% or reduce volume
hrv_guidance.red: Swap for easy day, prioritize recovery
hrv_guidance.no_hrv_alternative: Use perceived fatigue—heavy legs + low motivation = body says rest

polarized_distribution.z3_usage: Minimal—used sparingly for race-pace feel, not routine training

masters_recovery.intensity_spacing: Minimum 48 hours between hard sessions, often 72 hours optimal

cadence_work.hard_efforts: High cadence (95-105 rpm) on intensity—reduces muscular strain, improves recovery

strength_training.note: Athlete performs own strength program. CRITICAL for Masters: muscle mass declines ~1%/year after 40. Phases: Max (Weeks 1-4), Power (Weeks 4-6), Maintenance (Weeks 6-12).
strength_training.masters_emphasis: Non-negotiable for performance and injury prevention

monday_week_preview.description: Monday rest days include week preview, HRV guidance, and Masters-specific notes

rest_day_guidance.masters_recommendation: Complete rest recommended—light movement (walk, yoga) is fine
